column4: Maybe if I simplify the question it will be easier: How do I bring focus to an application currently running in the background?
I use win-tab for window switching with graphical apps... not sure if that helps
alt-tab is the less fancy version of that win-tab
yes, unfortunately it's not listed there...before the new version of ubuntu a small logo would show up near the block...but now - nothing
oh in the notificaion area?  Sure the process is running?
Dave123: ps aux | grep truecrypt shows it running, and if I click on the icon it says 'TrueCrypt is already running'
ps aux | grep truecrypt shows it running, and if I click on the icon it says 'TrueCrypt is already running'
You got me... not sure how you'd get it back if it's not in the systray, won't allow you to relaunch the GUI and killing and restarting the process isn't an option...
Though I'd guess there's a way.  I just don't know it.
yeah I figure someone knows how to access a running application that's in the background (not a shell APP!)
found a 'workaround' truecrypt -d = unmounted all current mounts
I had to install wmctrl first though.
thanks - I'm not sure why this is necessary in the first place... wonder why the system tray doesn't work properly
thanks again for the help - have a good one - must sleep now
